meanings.definition: A person who inspires or influences others, especially in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: In the world of science, Marie Curie is considered one of the luminaries.
meanings.sent2: The luminaries in the art world often have their works displayed in prestigious galleries.
meanings.sent3: The young students looked up to their teacher as a luminary in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: Her grandfather was a luminary in the community, always ready to help others.
meanings.sent5: The luminary speaker at the conference motivated everyone with her powerful words.

meanings.definition: Celestial bodies, such as stars or planets, that emit light.
meanings.sent1: During the stargazing event, we observed many luminaries shining brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers study the movement of luminaries to understand the universe better.
meanings.sent3: The children imagined the stars as tiny luminaries decorating the night sky.
meanings.sent4: The luminaries twinkled like diamonds scattered across the dark canvas of the sky.
meanings.sent5: The luminaries guided the sailors safely through the treacherous waters.
